definition[1]: raw substances are in a natural state and not treated or prepared for use
example[4]: In its raw state, cocoa is very bitter.
example[5]: Raw sewage had been dumped in the river.
example[6]: The cost of our raw materials has risen significantly.
definition[2]: raw information is collected but not organized, examined, or developed
example[7]: software to convert raw data into usable information
example[8]: His time here provided the raw material for his novel.
example[9]: Warhol used everyday items as the raw ingredients of his art.
definition[3]: raw feelings are strong and natural, but not fully controlled
example[11]: Linda didnâ€™t want to see Roy while her emotions were still raw.
example[12]: It took raw courage to admit she was wrong.
definition[4]: if a part of your body is raw, the skin there is red and painful
example[13]: The skin on my feet was rubbed raw.
definition[5]: not experienced or not fully trained
example[14]: Most of our soldiers are raw recruits.
example[15]: She shivered in the raw morning air.
definition[7]: music, art, language etc that is raw is simple, direct, and powerful, but not fully developed
example[16]: Her voice has a raw poetic beauty.
example[17]: His early sketches are raw and unpretentious.
definition[8]: raw metals or other substances are in their natural state and have not been prepared or used to make anything
example[18]: German companies produced 6.1% less raw iron in March.
definition[9]: information that has not been arranged, checked, or prepared in any way
example[20]: The system collects raw data about which products a customer has purchased.
